# Fabric Example Mod Kotlin - With Kotlin DSL
[![build](https://github.com/Laxystem/fabric-example-mod/actions/workflows/build.yml/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://github.com/Laxtstem/fabric-example-mod/actions/workflows/build.yml)
![Mod loader: Fabric](https://img.shields.io/badge/modloader-Fabric-1976d2?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/png;base64,)

![fabric-api](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@intergrav/devins-badges@3/assets/cozy/requires/fabric-api_vector.svg)

## Setup

1. Create a new mod repository by pressing the "Use this template" button and clone the created repository.
2. Import `build.gradle.kts` from [IntelliJ IDEA](https://jetbrains.com/idea).
   * It is recommended to install the [Minecraft Development](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/8327-minecraft-development) plugin.
3. Edit `core/build.gradle.kts` and `fabric.mod.json` to suit your needs.
   * In `settings.gradle.kts`, change `rootProject.name` to your project's name. 
   * The `mixins` object and the `modid.mixins.json` file can be removed from `fabric.mod.json` if you don't need mixins.
   * Replace all usage of `modid` (including the latter's file name) with your mod ID.
4. In `gradle.properties`, change `group` to a domain you owned, reversed (if you don't own a domain, use `io.github.<your github username>`).
5. Move your classes from `com.example.modid` to your new group and mod ID (`<group>.<modid>`).
6. Tweak your dependencies in `gradle/libs.versions.toml` if needed (fabric versions are available [here](https://fabricmc.net/develop/)).
7. Run!
